review.title: A tool for implementation of a domain model based on fuzzy relationships
review.abstract: The domain model is one of the important components used by adaptive learning systems to automatically generate customized courses for the learners. In this paper our contribution is to propose a new tool for implementation of a domain model based on fuzzy relationships among concepts. This tool allows the experts and teachers to find the best parameters in order to adapt the learners's differences.

sections.heading: III. APPROACH OF DOMAIN MODEL BASED ON FUZZY PREREQUISITE RELATIONSHIP
sections.text: In this approach, we use a domain model (learning hierarchy) that has been predefined by one or more experts in a particular field. In the first phase, we determine an initially predefined domain model, in the second phase, we measure the variation in the learning notes, then we transform the data using the fusion technique, in the next phase, we elaborate the rules of association between the concepts. In the last two phases, we propose to create the final model.
